parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To strike with panic or shock; I amaze, astonish. From ek and plesso; to strike with astonishment.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Well, nobly, honorably, rightly. Adverb from kalos; well.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(lit: blunted) dumb, dull, deaf. From kopto; blunted, i.e. of hearing or speech.
To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Unable to speak or articulate; speechless. Mute.
A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
